name: European Royalty Online Trivia | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: Queen Sophia of Spain was born into the royal family of which country?
questions.explanation:
Greece.

	She is the sister of ex-King Constantine of Greece.

questions.text: The Queen of Denmark is called?
questions.explanation:
Margrethe.

	She is Queen in her own right, not by marriage.

questions.text: What relationship is King Albert of Belgium to the previous King, Baudouin?
questions.explanation:
Brother.

	Albert is Baudoin's younger brother

questions.text: What is the family name of Prince Rainier of Monaco?
Who claims to be the heir to the French throne?
questions.explanation:
Comte de Paris.

	The Comte de Paris is the French claimant, there is also a Spanish one.

questions.text: Of which country was Beatrix the queen?
questions.explanation:
Netherlands.

	She succeeded her mother Juliana on the latter's abdication. Queen Beatrix abdicated in April 2013 and was succeeded by her son, King Willem-Alexander.

questions.text: What is the title of the ruler of Luxembourg?
questions.explanation:
Grand Duke.

	Luxembourgers have no princes, but many of their ladies have become Princesses or Queens by marriage.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a monarchy?
questions.explanation:
Finland.

	Scandinavia's royal families are sometimes known as 'bicycling monarchies' because of their relative informality, part of their success.

questions.text: Which country had a King called Carol?
questions.explanation:
Romania.

	He was the father of the last King of Romania, Michael, who was exiled after World War II.

questions.text: Which country's first monarch was Queen Victoria's uncle?
questions.explanation:
Belgium.

	Leopold, a German prince, became independent Belgium's first king.
